intro: Rubus koehleri var. gredensis, commonly known as the Gredens raspberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits known as drupes, which are typically red or yellow when ripe. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
